name: K2-323
scenarioDescription:
The K2-323 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-323 is a star with 0.48 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.55 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

K2-323 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-323 system


K2-323 b

K2-323 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-323 b is 5.0562000000000005 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-323 b is 2.1 that of Earth. At 5.0562000000000005 Earth masses, K2-323 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-323, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
